revised_title: The Mechanism of Human Voice Production
tldr: John Bishop investigates the cause of grave and acute tones in the human voice, concluding that the modulation of tones is not solely due to variations in vocal chord length, tension, or glottis aperture. He proposes that the vocal organs combine properties of wind and stringed musical instruments, with the length of the vibrating portions of the vocal chords determining the tone's gravity or acuteness.
